35232142: Flooding in Dumfries and Galloway and the Scottish Borders has caused widespread damage, with repair work ongoing and a flood alert remaining in place due to constant rain.
40143035: A fire deliberately started under two tour buses parked at a Northern Ireland hotel, destroying personal belongings and forcing tour groups to reschedule their itinerary.
35951548: Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton secured pole position for the Bahrain Grand Prix, beating teammate Nico Rosberg by 0.077 seconds after a thrilling qualifying session.
36266422: A 67-year-old former scout leader in Lincolnshire faces 22 charges, including indecency with a child, after four male complainants alleged sexual abuse between 1972 and 1989.
38826984: A man receiving psychiatric treatment at a Turkish hospital threatened to shoot himself and others, prompting an evacuation and police negotiation.
34540833: Glasgow Warriors secured a narrow 22-19 win over the Dragons, with Simone Favaro scoring the decisive try in the final minutes of the game.
20836172: A 31-year-old woman was killed and another man injured when an Audi A3 struck them in Streatham, London, with police searching for a 27-year-old man linked to the car.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Antoine Demoitie, 25, died after a collision with a motorbike during the Gent-Wevelgem race, prompting calls for improved safety measures in professional cycling.
40758845: Ilkay Gundogan is recovering from a knee injury and expects to return to the pitch in "weeks" rather than months, with City set to face Tottenham in their final US tour match.
30358490: A man in his 20s was seriously injured in a car crash on the A127 in Essex, suffering a head injury and multiple fractures, and was airlifted to the Royal London Hospital.
34615665: A tropical storm has hit mainland Mexico for the first time since 1959, with a rating of category 1, the highest rating a tropical storm can achieve.
35890902: Researchers from Bastille Networks found vulnerabilities in wireless mice that allowed attackers to spoof signals and take control of computers using a $20 kit and a few lines of code.
37922330: Administrators confirmed 38 redundancies at Galashiels-based Murray and Burrell due to "adverse trading conditions" after the business went into administration last week.
30844962: The European Commission has expressed doubts that Luxembourg's tax arrangement with Amazon constitutes state aid, sparking an investigation into potential tax avoidance.
36217333: The Balmoral Show, a 148-year-old agricultural event, returns for its fourth year at Balmoral Park, featuring local produce, livestock, and family-friendly activities.
30816523: Lord Mosley is suing Google for breaching the Data Protection Act and misusing private information by hosting images of him at a 2008 sex party.
38900884: Dragons forwards coach Ceri Jones says the team will miss injured player Eddie Jackson, but sees it as an opportunity for others to step up.
13890581: The UK government has secured a three-year funding package to support the Cornish Language Partnership, ensuring the language's survival and paving the way for long-term local funding.
40194700: AS Monaco manager Leonardo Jardim has signed a new contract with the club, praising the last three years as "exceptional" and expressing his commitment to the team.
37903647: Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega won re-election with 72.5% of the vote, but the US State Department has questioned the election's legitimacy due to opposition candidate suppression and lack of international observers.
